page.title: 08CLUBS IN STANHOE
page.content: Thirty years ago Stanhoe could boast of a Football, Cricket, Bowls and Darts Club as well as a Youth Club, but with a falling population and less young people these are now closed. Only Stanhoe & Barwick Women's Institute has been continuously active since it was founded in 1919 and still has twenty members who meet regularly every month for talks and demonstrations. This year members have attended meetings in Norwich and enjoyed outings to Northamptonshire and to Oxburgh in Norfolk. Fund raising events for local charities are a feature. The Social Club, founded seven years ago arranges indoor sports, whistdrives and dances as well as managing the running of the Village Hall. This year has seen the re-forming of the football club.
